data_quality_stringency: A filter parameter: A called variant needs to have a mean log-likelihood difference per read greater than this Phred-scaled value
downsample_to_coverage: Reduce coverage in over-sampled locations to this value to save computational time
snp_min_cov_each_strand: A filter parameter: Minimum coverage required on each strand for a SNP to be called
snp_min_variant_score: A filter parameter: A called SNP needs to have a QUAL score greater than this Phred-scaled value
snp_min_allele_freq: A filter parameter: A called SNP needs to have an allele frequency greater than this value
snp_min_coverage: A filter parameter: A called SNP location needs to have a coverage greater than this value
snp_strand_bias: A filter parameter: A candidate SNP will be filtered out if its strand bias p-value is less than snp_strand_bias_pval and its strand bias is greater than snp_strand_bias
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0.5 and 1.0
snp_strand_bias_pval: A filter parameter: A candidate SNP will be filtered out if its strand bias p-value is less than snp_strand_bias_pval and its strand bias is greater than snp_strand_bias
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
Suggested trial value 0.01 for strand bias filter, 1 for no strand bias filter
mnp_min_cov_each_strand: A filter parameter: Minimum coverage required on each strand for a MNP to be called
mnp_min_variant_score: A filter parameter: A called MNP needs to have a QUAL score greater than this Phred-scaled value
mnp_min_allele_freq: A filter parameter: A called MNP needs to have an allele frequency greater than this value
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
mnp_min_coverage: A filter parameter: A called MNP location needs to have a coverage greater than this value
mnp_strand_bias: A filter parameter: A candidate MNP will be filtered out if its strand bias p-value is less than mnp_strand_bias_pval and its strand bias is greater than mnp_strand_bias
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0.5 and 1.0
mnp_strand_bias_pval: A filter parameter: A candidate MNP will be filtered out if its strand bias p-value is less than mnp_strand_bias_pval and its strand bias is greater than mnp_strand_bias
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
indel_min_cov_each_strand: A filter parameter: Minimum coverage required on each strand for an indel to be called
indel_min_variant_score: A filter parameter: A called indel needs to have a QUAL score greater than this Phred-scaled value
indel_min_allele_freq: A filter parameter: A called indel needs to have an allele frequency greater than this value
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
indel_min_coverage: A filter parameter: A called indel location needs to have a coverage greater than this value
indel_strand_bias: A filter parameter: A candidate indel will be filtered out if its strand bias p-value is less than indel_strand_bias_pval and its strand bias is greater than indel_strand_bias
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0.5 and 1.0
indel_strand_bias_pval: A filter parameter: A candidate indel will be filtered out if its strand bias p-value is less than indel_strand_bias_pval and its strand bias is greater than indel_strand_bias
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
hotspot_min_cov_each_strand: A filter parameter: Minimum coverage required on each strand for a hotspot variant to be called
hotspot_min_variant_score: A filter parameter: A called hotspot variant needs to have a QUAL score greater than this Phred-scaled value
hotspot_min_allele_freq: A filter parameter: A called hotspot variant needs to have an allele frequency greater than this value
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
hotspot_min_coverage: A filter parameter: A called hotspot variant location needs to have a coverage greater than this value
hotspot_strand_bias: A filter parameter: A candidate hotspot variant will be filtered out if its strand bias p-value is less than hotspot_strand_bias_pval and its strand bias is greater than hotspot_strand_bias
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0.5 and 1.0
hotspot_strand_bias_pval: A filter parameter: A candidate hotspot variant will be filtered out if its strand bias p-value is less than hotspot_strand_bias_pval and its strand bias is greater than hotspot_strand_bias
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1.0
prediction_precision: A variant evaluation parameter: The number of pseudo data points suggesting our predictions match the measurements without bias
outlier_probability: A variant evaluation parameter: probability that a read comes from none of the models under consideration
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1.0
heavy_tailed: A variant evaluation parameter: The degree of freedom of the t-distribution for modeling the heavy tail in signal residual distribution
filter_unusual_predictions: A filter parameter:  A called variant needs to have RBI less than this value
Related VCF fields: RBI = sqrt(FWDB ^ 2 + REVB ^ 2)
filter_insertion_predictions: A filter parameter:  Filter out an insertion if the observed clusters deviate from predictions more than this amount
filter_deletion_predictions: A filter parameter:  Filter out a deletion if the observed clusters deviate from predictions more than this amount
indel_as_hpindel: A filter parameter: A flag indicating whether INDEL filters or SNP filters should be applied to non-HP indels
Allowed values: 0 = use SNP filter, 1 = use INDEL filter
hp_max_length: A filter parameter: HP indels of more than this length will be filtered out
sse_prob_threshold: A filter parameter: Filter threshold for motif-predicted error probability
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
min_ratio_reads_non_sse_strand: A filter parameter: When the variant allele threshold is greater than this value based on one strand, allow a variant to pass the filter even if the error probability is high on the other strand
do_snp_realignment: A variant candidate evaluating parameter: Realign reads in the vicinity of SNP candidates when set
Allowed values: 0 = do not realign, 1 = realign
do_mnp_realignment: A variant candidate evaluating parameter: Realign reads in the vicinity of MNP candidates when set
Allowed values: 0 = do not realign, 1 = realign
realignment_threshold: A variant candidate evaluating parameter: Maximum allowed fraction of reads where realignment causes an alignment change
suppress_recalibration: A variant evaluation parameter: Homopolymer recalibration values should not be used when set
Allowed values: 0 = allow recalibration, 1 = don't allow recalibration
use_position_bias: A filter parameter: Enable the position bias filter when set
position_bias: A filter parameter: Filter out a variant if the position bias is greater than position_bias and the position bias p-value is less than position_bias_pval
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
position_bias_pval: A filter parameter: Filter out a variant if the position bias is greater than position_bias and the position bias p-value is less than position_bias_pval
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
position_bias_ref_fraction: A filter parameter: Skip the position bias filter if (reference read count) / (reference and alt read count) <= this value
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
min_tag_fam_size: Minimum number of reads with same molecular tag required to form a functional family
Impact: Increasing values make variant calls less sensitive but more specific
indel_func_size_offset: A tagseq parameter: require family of size >= (min_tag_fam_size + this value) to be functional for calling HP-INDEL
Impact: Increasing values make variant calls less sensitive but more specific
min_detail_level_for_fast_scan: A variant candidate evaluating parameter: The minimum detail-level to trigger the fast scan algorithm that considerably speeds up the evaluator.
Allowed values: >=0 (0 = always apply the fast scan algorithm)
tag_trim_method: A tagseq parameter: "strict-trim" requires that the UID must match the format specified in the run plan, while "sloppy-trim" does not.
snp_min_var_coverage: A filter parameter: Minimum number of variant coverage after flow-evaluation required to make a SNP call
Impact: Increasing values make variant calls less sensitive but more specific
indel_min_var_coverage: A filter parameter: Minimum number of variant coverage after flow-evaluation required to make a INDEL call
Impact: Increasing values make variant calls less sensitive but more specific
mnp_min_var_coverage: A filter parameter: Minimum number of variant coverage after flow-evaluation required to make a MNP call
Impact: Increasing values make variant calls less sensitive but more specific
hotspot_min_var_coverage: A filter parameter: Minimum number of variant coverage after flow-evaluation required to make a hotspot call
Impact: Increasing values make variant calls less sensitive but more specific
fd_nonsnp_min_var_cov: A filter parameter: Override min_var_coverage of the flow-disrupted variants that are not SNPs (0 to disable the override)
Impact: Decreasing values make variant calls less specific but more sensitive
tag_sim_max_cov: A filter parameter: Check the similarity of UID of variant molecules if the variant molecular coverage <= this value
use_lod_filter: A filter parameter: Enable the Limit Of Detection (LOD) filter
Allowed values: 0 = do not use LOD filter, 1 = use LOD filter
lod_multiplier: A filter parameter: Multiplier of LOD for filtering out variants with low alt allele frequency
try_few_restart_freq: A variant evaluation parameter: Speed up the evaluator by trying fewer initial guesses of allele frequency
report_ppa: Report Possible Polyploidy Alleles (PPA) in the INFO FIELD of the vcf lines.
Allowed values: 1 = report PPA, 0 = do not report
min_ratio_for_fd: A filter parameter: Claim flow-disruption if the portion of reads that are flow-disrupted >= this value
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
hotspots_as_de_novo: A filter parameter: Use de novo (snp, mnp, indel) parameter sets for hotspot variants.
Allowed values: 0 = use hotspot parameter set, 1 = use de novo parameter set.
hp_indel_hrun: A filter parameter: Define the HRUN for filtering HP-INDEL variants with lengths specified by "hp_del_len" and "hp_ins_len".
Allowed values: vector of positive integers (e.g. [1,2,3]) with size matches "hp_del_len" and "hp_ins_len".
hp_ins_len: A filter parameter: Filter out HP-INS variants whose INS length <= the corresponding entry of this vector if the HRUN is defined in "hp_indel_hrun".
Allowed values: vector of non-negative integers (e.g. [1,2,3]) with size matches "hp_del_len" and "hp_indel_hrun".
hp_del_len: A filter parameter: Filter out HP-DEL variants whose DEL length <= the corresponding entry of this vector if the HRUN is defined in "hp_indel_hrun".
Allowed values: vector of non-negative integers (e.g. [1,2,3]) with size matches "hp_ins_len" and "hp_indel_hrun".
use_fd_param: A filtering parameter: Use Flow Disruptiveness (FD) instead of allele types (INDEL, SNP, MNP) as the criterion to choose the parameter set.
If turned on, the (non-FD, moderate FD, FD) allele applies the the (INDEL, SNP, MNP) parameters, respectively.
Allowed values: 0: do not use FD parameters, 1: use FD parameters.
max_flows_to_test: A variant candidate evaluating parameter: The maximum number of scoring flows being used.
Suggested trial value 10 (20 if the Hotspots file contains long variants)
error_motifs: The file name of the error motif file.

read_snp_limit: Do not use reads with number of snps above this
allow_indels: Candidate generation parameter: Allow indel candidates to be generated when set
Allowed values: 1 = generate indel candidates, 0 = don't generate
allow_snps: Candidate generation parameter: Allow SNP candidates to be generated when set
Allowed values: 1 = generate SNP hypotheses, 0 = don't generate
allow_mnps: Candidate generation parameter: Allow MNP candidates to be generated when set
Allowed values: 1 = generate MNP hypotheses, 0 = don't generate
allow_complex: Candidate generation parameter: Allow complex variant candidates to be generated when set
Allowed values: 1 = generate MNP hypotheses, 0 = don't generate
min_mapping_qv: A candidate generation and variant evaluation parameter: Minimum mapping quality value required for a read to be considered (for both candidate generation and variant evaluation)
read_max_mismatch_fraction: A candidate generation parameter: Ignore reads with fraction of mismatch greater than this value
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
gen_min_alt_allele_freq: A candidate generation parameter: A non-HP-indel candidate needs to have an allele frequency greater than this value in the pileup
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
gen_min_indel_alt_allele_freq: A candidate generation parameter: An HP-indel candidate needs to have an allele frequency greater than this value in the pileup
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
gen_min_coverage: A candidate generation parameter: A variant candidate location needs to have coverage depth greater than this value
read_mismatch_limit: A read filtering parameter: Do not use reads with number of mismatches (where 1 gap open counts 1) above this value
Allowed value: Integers >= 0, (0 to disable this filter)
min_cov_fraction: A read filtering parameter: Do not use reads with fraction of covering the best assigned unmerged target region below this
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1

kmer_len: Size of the smallest k-mer used in assembly
Impact: Increasing values make indel calls less sensitive but more specific
min_var_count: Minimum support for a variant to be evaluated
Impact: Increasing values make indel calls less sensitive but more specific
short_suffix_match: Minimum assembled sequence match on both sides of the variant
Suggested trial value between 4 and kmer_len
Impact: Increasing values make indel calls less sensitive but more specific
min_indel_size: Minimum size indel reported by assembly
Impact: Increasing values make indel calls less sensitive but more specific
max_hp_length: Variants containing HP larger than this are not reported
Impact: Increasing values make indel calls more sensitive but less specific
min_var_freq: Minimum frequency of the variant to be reported
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
Impact: Increasing values make indel calls less sensitive but more specific
relative_strand_bias: Variants with strand bias above this are not reported
Allowed values: Decimal numbers between 0 and 1
Impact: Increasing values make indel calls more sensitive but less specific
output_mnv: Allowed values: 1 = report complex variants, 0 = don't report
